Title: He dragged America deeper into the Middle Eastern quagmire': Wha...
Description: Ronald Reagan's Middle East policy was a fiasco from beginning to end, says Washington Post columnist Max Boot, who has just written an authoritative new biography on the GOP legend. The next U.S. president would do well to study his mishandling of crises with Israel, Lebanon and Iran

Title: Israel is under pressure, but who is pushing Iran to stand down?
Description: As the Middle East holds its breath waiting for Israel's counter-strike, it's vital to break the escalation towards military armageddon. Title: Israeli army economizing on weapons use amid arms embargoes, sour...
Description: To better prioritize use of weaponry, the Israeli army raised the rank of officers allowed to approve use of mortars and other weaponry as ammunition inventories dwindle

Title: Iranian missile attack against Israel caused up to $53 million in...
Description: Since Iran fired around 180 ballistic missiles at Israel earlier in October, around 2,500 claims for damage to buildings, vehicles and contents have been submitted to the Israeli Tax Authority's property tax department

Title: Targeted by Hezbollah missiles, Palestinians in Israel are accuse...
Description: When Hezbollah launched missiles at the Galilee Arab towns of Kafr Manda and Sakhnin and their 55,000 residents, it claimed the towns were military bases, and Arab news outlets labeled them as Israeli settlements. That triggered sarcasm, if not rage, among the towns' Palestinian residents

Title: A community, not just a venue': Israel's last Palestinian underg...
Description: Haifa's Kabareet was established nine years ago to connect the underground scene in Ramallah with Jaffa and Haifa – and was blacklisted by BDS activists. But amid missiles from Lebanon on its final night, one of its founders says: 'When there's war every two years, we just keep struggling'

Title: Israeli defense officials: Gov't pushing aside hostage deal, eyei...
Description: IDF commanders in Gaza say the recent decision to operate in the northern part of the Strip was taken without proper deliberations, and is apparently aimed at pressuring civilians in the area to relocate

Title: A Palestinian state where Jews and Muslims live in brotherhood: A...
Description: In October 1974, PLO Chairman Yasser Arafat laid out his vision for the new Middle East, but refused to reject terrorism. That same day, members of a new movement tried to establish settlements in the West Bank. A glimpse at a 50-year-old edition of Haaretz that is still relevant today

Title: Bracing for Israeli strike, Iran says it has 'no red lines' in de...
Description: Statement by Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi's appear intended to dispel suggestions that Iran would absorb an Israeli strike without a further response as it did in April

Title: Israel releases American journalist arrested for disclosing intel...
Description: After U.S. citizen and Grayzone journalist Jeremy Loffredo was arrested by Israel Police for revealing where Iranian missiles fell during this month's attack in a YouTube video, the Jerusalem District Court ordered his release

Title: Christopher Columbus was a Sephardi Jew from Western Europe, Span...
Description: After a 22-year DNA investigation, researchers finally solved the mystery over the origins of the divisive figure and revealed the results on Spain's national broadcaster: Columbus and his son were of Jewish origin

Title: I think Israel and the army did everything at first, but now peo...
Description: Bipin Joshi, a Nepalese student abducted by Hamas during the October 7 attack on Kibbutz Alumim, showed extraordinary courage by throwing back a grenade to protect his friends. Now held captive in Gaza, his companions in Israel await his return

Title: I've known my brother for 20 years. I don't know what kind of br...
Description: Nimrod Cohen was kidnapped from a tank that malfunctioned near Israel's border with Gaza. His brother, Yotam, says that his family have stopped being private people: 'We are fighting the government, the cabinet, the media for coverage, so that they will remember him'

Title: Gunfire here, aerial bombing there: Israel steps up the Gaza-fica...

Title: Israeli gov't to remove footage used without families' consent fr...

Title: Thai worker killed in northern Israel; IDF: Possibly hit by unexp...
Description: Nisan Miram, a 42-year-old migrant worker from Thailand, was employed in an apple orchard. Another worker who was with him experienced anxiety. Since the onset of the war, 42 foreign workers from Thailand have been killed, the majority during the Hamas attack on October 7

Title: A regional war is brewing in the Middle East, and the U.S. has no...

Title: After his year of war and ruin, Netanyahu won't be atoning this Y...

Title: Netanyahu prioritizes petty vengeance against defense chief Galla...
Description: While Israeli Defense Minister Gallant earned the trust of the U.S., Netanyahu's ties with Biden sharply deteriorated. One year after Oct. 7, the PM still sees Gallant as an enemy over his support for a hostage release deal, opposition to the judicial coup – and growing popularity

Title: Netanyahu still uncertain on Iran response, as Israeli army pushe...
Description: Israel's PM is having a good run: Hezbollah is crippled, the U.S. supports ground offensives in Lebanon, Iran's attack didn't do any major damage and gives him license to strike back. Unfortunately, his focus is currently on catchy names for Israel's multi-front war

Title: I constantly wonder if Sasha is managing to hold on to hope in G...
Description: Sasha Troufanov was kidnapped to Gaza from his home in Kibbutz Nir Oz. His childhood friend, who runs a command center advocating for his release, says 'it's Sasha's basic right to live the life he planned and return to his girlfriend and mother'

Title: Investigation: Netanyahu's government not only permits Jewish ter...
Description: Settlers call it a revolution: More than 60 illegal farm outposts have sprung up in the West Bank during the past seven years, seizing vast tracts of Palestinian land. With cheap labor provided by 'at-risk' youths, this enterprise has also become a main fomenter of Jewish terror in the territories – and the state is generously footing the bill

Title: Three Israeli soldiers killed in Gaza Strip combat operations
Description: The three reservists served in the IDF's 460th Brigade and were killed Thursday by an explosive device

Title: NSO's cash-for-cyber deal pushed by Israeli official sparks crimi...
Description: Israel's Defense Ministry actively supported NSO's sale of spyware in exchange for millions in cash, flown to Israel by private jet, but Colombian authorities deny purchasing it. Colombia has severed diplomatic relations with Israel, which may complicate their ability to obtain legal assistance from Israel

Title: Cash-for-cyber deal pushed by an Israeli official turned into a c...
Description: Israel's Defense Ministry actively supported NSO's sale of the spyware in return to millions in cash, flown to Israel on private jet, but Colombian authorities deny buying it. Colombia severed diplomatic relations with Israel, which may make it difficult for them to obtain legal assistance from Israel

Title: Shin Bet says it didn't seek diplomatic passport for PM's son Yai...
Description: Former Foreign Minister Eli Cohen had justified issuing the passport on grounds of security for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's son, which the Shin Bet denies. Police are investigating whether Netanyahu's associates were behind the request, which went against standard procedure

Title: Please come save us': Recordings of kibbutz hostage standoff rev...
Description: On October 7, Hamas terrorists held 15 Israeli civilians hostage at a home in Kibbutz Be'eri, demanding safe passage to Gaza. Recordings of phone calls obtained by Haaretz reveal critical communication failures between the various Israeli security forces involved in the rescue efforts, contributing to the deaths of all but two hostages

Description: Joshua Tartakovsky, a 42-year-old that holds British and Israeli citizenships, was arrested in the Lebanese capital, which he entered as a journalist

Title: Israeli citizen arrested in Beirut deported from Lebanon
Description: Joshua Tartakovsky, a 42-year-old that holds British and Israeli citizenships, was arrested in the Lebanese capital, which he entered as a journalist

Title: One killed, six wounded in stabbing rampage in central Israeli ci...
Description: The victim of the attack was named as Raphael Mordechai Fishoff, a 35-year-old Hadera resident. Medics reported that six others were also wounded after a 36-year-old resident of the Israeli-Arab city of Umm al-Fahm carried out a suspected terror attack, according to Israel Police

Title: Arab Israeli educator released after arrest over video allegedly ...
Description: Intisar Hijazi was arrested after posting a video of herself dancing and smiling with the caption 'On This Day 7/10/2023.' Israel Police later released her under restrictive conditions but stated that the investigation is still ongoing

Title: IDF names Israeli soldier killed in fighting in southern Lebanon
Description: Ronny Gazinate immigrated with his family from France to Israel, and is survived by his wife and three children. In the same incident in which Gazinate was killed, another reservist was seriously wounded

Title: Missile fired from Lebanon explodes in West Bank; Sirens blare ac...
Description: Shin Bet arrests five West Bank residents over planned terror plot at Tel Aviv mall ■ Report: U.S. seeks to use Israel's offensive in Lebanon to oust Hezbollah, Egypt and Qatar say plan unrealistic ■ IDF says 40 rockets from Lebanon target northern Israel in latest barrage ■ IDF says it intercepted drone launched from Gaza into Israel ■ Israeli reserve soldier killed in combat in northern Israel, another seriously wounded

Title: At least 28 killed in Israeli strike on Gaza shelter, rescuers sa...
Description: Shin Bet arrests five West Bank residents over planned terror plot at Tel Aviv mall ■ Report: U.S. seeks to use Israel's offensive in Lebanon to oust Hezbollah, Egypt and Qatar say plan unrealistic ■ IDF says 40 rockets from Lebanon target northern Israel in latest barrage ■ IDF says it intercepted drone launched from Gaza into Israel ■ Israeli reserve soldier killed in combat in northern Israel, another seriously wounded

Title: Report: U.S. seeks to use Israel's offensive in Lebanon to oust H...
Description: Syrian state media reports explosions in Homs, city of Daraa ■ Six people wounded in a stabbing attack in central Israel, one critically ■ IDF intercepts two Hezbollah missiles aimed at northern and central Israel ■ 42,010 Palestinians killed in Gaza since war started, Hamas-run Health Ministry says

Title: Israeli army announces name of reservist killed in fighting in so...
Description: Syrian state media reports explosions in Homs, city of Daraa ■ Six people wounded in a stabbing attack in central Israel, one critically ■ IDF intercepts two Hezbollah missiles aimed at northern and central Israel ■ 42,010 Palestinians killed in Gaza since war started, Hamas-run Health Ministry says

Title: How can I go back to routine when my son is in the tunnels of Ga...
Description: Israeli hostage Omer Wenkert was abducted from the Nova Festival on October 7. He was documented alive in a Hamas video, tied up in a pickup truck next to lifeless bodies. 'We then realized that Israel doesn't have him, and our crusade to get him back home began,' says his mother, Niva Wenkert

Title: Brown University votes against divestment proposal, angering pro-...
Description: University heads said in a statement that 'Brown's mission doesn't encompass resolving or adjudicating global conflict,' after rejecting a proposal to divest from 10 companies student groups say enable 'Israeli occupation of Palestinian territory'

Title: Two Israeli police officers investigated for arrest of women call...
Description: Two senior Israeli officers are suspected of abusing their authority, fraud and breach of trust after ordering the arrests of women who handed out leaflets calling to release Israeli hostages in a synagogue attended by MK Yuli Edelstein. One is also suspected of obstruction of justice

Title: EU aviation agency cancels recommendation against flying to Israe...
Description: The European Union Aviation Safety Agency now recommends that airlines 'implement a stringent monitoring process and risk assessment for each flight when intending to operate within the airspace of Israel.' The new recommendations are valid until the end of October

Title: Top Court orders Tel Aviv to allow gender-segregated service for ...
Description: The judges criticized the Tel Aviv municipality for their decision of prohibiting segregated services, saying the city seeks to discriminate against orthodox worshipers, and ordered that they hold the prayer service with a gender partition

Title: German journalist arrested in Beirut after interview with Israeli...
Description: Paul Ronzheimer, who serves as the Deputy Editor-in-Chief for the German Bild newspaper, was detained, interrogated and held overnight in the Lebanese capital after he gave a brief interview to the Israeli Kan news channel. He was released after efforts by the German embassy in Lebanon

Title: Revealed: The face of the biggest arthropod that ever lived
Description: Primordial Earth was graced by giant bugs but the identity of the biggest of them all – Arthropleura at 8 feet and counting – has been a mystery. Now one with a head has finally been found

Two Israelis killed in Hezbollah rocket barrage on northern Israe...
Description: The two, a man and woman in their 40s, were walking their dogs when they were hit by a rocket launched from Lebanon. Later in the day, six Israelis were wounded by rocket debris in the Haifa area after a barrage of Hezbollah rockets targeted the city

Title: Israel at war, day 369: Two killed, several wounded as Hezbollah ...
Description: Two killed, several wounded, by Hezbollah rocket barrages on Israel's north ■ Seven wounded in stabbing attack in central Israel; Attacker, a resident of the Israeli-Arab town of Umm al-Fahm, arrested ■ Netanyahu spoke with Biden and VP Harris on Israel's planned retaliatory strike against Iran ■ Israel strikes Beirut's Dahiyeh ■ 130 IDF soldiers warn they won't serve unless gov't works to obtain a hostage/cease-fire deal ■ Syrian state media: Seven killed in Israeli strike on Damascus ■ Here's what you need to know 369 days into the war

Title: Israel central bank holds interest rates, but says wartime inflat...
Description: Israel's annual inflation rate rose to 3.6 percent in August, stemming largely from supply constraints related to the expanding war on multiple fronts. Some investors have begun to speculate that inflation will continue to rise and possibly push the central bank to raising rates again

Title: An Israeli attack on Iran's nuclear sites would push Tehran to as...
Description: The Iranians have declared that if Israel attacks the sites they will abandon the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty and become a nuclear state. I suggest that we not take their declarations lightly

Description: IDF says fourth division has joined ground offensive in Lebanon ■ U.S. is reportedly not pursuing efforts for cease-fire along Israel-Lebanon border at this moment ■ CIA chief Bill Burns: Israel 'weighing very carefully' how to respond to Iran's ballistic missile attack last week ■ WHO official warns of 'higher risk of disease outbreaks' in Lebanon ■ what you need to know 368 days into the war

Title: A Tel Aviv rooftop garden tells the survival stories of Israel's ...
Description: The project by the Asif Culinary Institute invited farmers from Israel's north and south to plant crops meaningful to them on a rooftop plot in Tel Aviv – to tell their stories and help plant new roots

Title: Arab Israeli arrested for social media post allegedly celebrating...
Description: Police arrested Intisar Hijazi, 41, and photographed her blindfolded and handcuffed under an Israeli flag for a social media post they claim was 'disturbing public peace.' She was arrested after National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir complained about the post

Title: After October 7, just how far right will Israel go?

Title: For a mother, when her child is a hostage, he's a hostage. It do...
Description: For me, he is alive,' says Yael Adar, mother of hostage Tamir Adar, who the IDF announced was killed in captivity. 'Cognitively, I know he's not, but emotionally I allow myself the illusion that maybe there was a mistake, that maybe he will be found injured, that he'll return'

Title: West Bank's Palestinians fear Israeli army and settlers will stop...
Description: The current olive harvest season is especially important for the Palestinians given the economic hardship caused by the war. Settlers have already used violence against harvesters, and many fear that the army won't provide adequate protection and will prevent them from accessing their lands

Title: The October 7 massacre gave another dimension to my work with hu...
Description: Since October 7, Naama Sabato, a social worker specializing in trauma and human trafficking, has turned to art for solace and as a way to raise awareness of the struggles faced by hostages' families
